channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Noisy manhole cover, 11th December
item.description:
Every time a car drives over it it makes a massive noise. This is affecting my ability to sleep as it's white right Infront of my house

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 262, Ballards Lane, Fallow Corner, Greater London

item.title: Broken recycling bin, 11th December
item.description:
The recycling bin outside block three has been vadalised and is missing it's lid. Therefor the is no point in putting recycled items out as it will get contaminated by rain,vermin etc. This problem has been reported before but the council ignores the problem. In other news, the residents of block three Casterbridge road have judt spent five days without a lift. Greenwich Council the most useless and corrupt council in London.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casterbridge Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping continues with no action to prevent it, 11th December
item.description:
The photos were taken a day apart (10 and 11 Dec 2025). They show that bulky items were dumped last night. This is the area on Arnold Estate where Sweeney Crescent meets the back of Devon Mansions. Flytipping in this area has been reported several times on this site over the past few months. Rubbish is cleared away but nothing is done to prevent flytipping so it happens again and again. This issue is not resolved until the flytipping stops. This area provides access for emergency vehicles into the estate and must remain clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180-230, Sweeney Crescent, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless encampment, 11th December
item.description:
An individual has been sleeping outside the capitol pub in forest hill. The site is now looking semi-permanent and the individual was seen publicly urinating in view of school children at the adjacent bus stop this morning. Kindly refer to street link. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11-21, London Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty nappies strewn in street - health hazard, 11th December
item.description:
As in Stamford Grove East, foxes have opened the bags left for overnight collect in Stamford Grove West, and strewn nappies in the street. Please provide alternative collection for rubbish on Oldhill, this is starting to happen daily.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Grove West, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
